items.title: Bug : requests-file not supporting web framework errors - leads to xss vulnerability
items.body:
##### _if you have any error in python web frameworks, the server will be send (500 : internal error error) in the response without print the error name or code_ **(without debugging Mode)**
here im using requests module to send http request
### _with error_ : #### you can't find the errors in your code (without debugging Mode) * Error in Flask Framework ![errr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81969979-134a2400-961f-11ea-801b-ae0f820ae3c5.png) * Error in tornado Framework ![ter_err](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81975116-d8e48500-9626-11ea-8ad0-15371de0283a.png) ### without error : * Flask Framework ![without_errr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81970134-51474800-961f-11ea-9d15-3da784345035.png) * tornado Framework ![ter_no](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81975236-029dac00-9627-11ea-9e68-6d2687a970be.png) ## but in requests-file it's so different ## with error : * Flask Framework ![err_req](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81970562-04b03c80-9620-11ea-9bd9-8a9862c539e4.png) * tornado Framework ![ter_err_f](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81975529-7770e600-9627-11ea-8ef2-a09ba914a1a8.png) #### this not a secure for the app :X ### now the attacker can be use this error for XSS Attacks because The error was printed on the page without any filter * Flask Framework ![xss_req](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81970957-9b7cf900-9620-11ea-853c-69afff0dfd32.png) * tornado Framework ![ter_xss](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81976549-fdd9f780-9628-11ea-9be7-e45e157a205b.png) hmmm let's try to add xss payload in requests like requests-file * Flask Framework ![no_xss](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81976742-4a253780-9629-11ea-84a8-f4103d0b3e54.png) * tornado Framework ![ter_no_xss](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45688522/81976867-72ad3180-9629-11ea-9353-3a5e01e19295.png) why i can't find any xss like requests-file .? * because requests module supporting web errors not like requests-file ## impact : **now All requests-file users(web dev) are vulnerable to this attack (XSS),With the help of xss a hacker or attacker can perform social engineering on users by redirecting them from real website to fake one. hacker can steal their cookies and download a malware on their system, and there are many more attacking scenarios a skilled attacker can perform with xss.** ### Video : https://youtu.be/oxp_cE0qPeU ### Web Lab's : https://github.com/knassar702/theproject ### About xss : https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/xss/

items.title: Latest version 1.5 not longer compatible with python 2.7
items.body:
Hello,

  We just noticed that the most recent version upgrade included a line that is not compatible with Python 2.7. This is a stacktrace of the error when trying to use it from tldextract.

```
>>> 
>>> import tldextract
>>> tldextract.extract('xx.com')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "tldextract/tldextract.py", line 303, in extract
    return TLD_EXTRACTOR(url)
  File "tldextract/tldextract.py", line 183, in __call__
    suffix_index = self._get_tld_extractor().suffix_index(translations)
  File "tldextract/tldextract.py", line 223, in _get_tld_extractor
    raw_suffix_list_data = find_first_response(self.suffix_list_urls)
  File "tldextract/remote.py", line 37, in find_first_response
    session.mount('file://', FileAdapter())
  File "requests_file.py", line 14, in __init__
    super().__init__()
TypeError: super() takes at least 1 argument (0 given)
```

As a quick workaround we created a fork and pushed this change: https://github.com/AirPR/requests-file/commit/d9c580ef250aaf708eb48b48c302a92d7f63dcf6 (this was affecting a prod system).

items.title: FileAdapter does not properly close FileIO resources
items.body:
When opening local files using the FileAdapter in requests, the following `ResourceWarning` is thrown during unit tests:

```
ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.FileIO name='/Users/my_user/Projects/my_project/path/to/my/data/big_data_list.dat' mode='rb' closefd=True>
```
This is happening on Python 3.7.4 interpreter.  Converting the [response object](https://github.com/dashea/requests-file/blob/master/requests_file.py#L31) to an instance variable, and then calling `self._resp.raw.close()` within the [FileAdapter.close()](https://github.com/dashea/requests-file/blob/master/requests_file.py#L109) method resolves this problem.

I can submit a pull request, if needed.

items.title: Unable to open relative paths
items.body:
How would I access relative paths?

>>> session.mount('file://', FileAdapter())
>>> session.get('file:///./some_sort_of.yaml')
<Response [404]>
>>>

items.title: debian packaging
items.body:
Hi,

For your information, I am working on packaging this library for debian. You can follow the progress of this effort in [#879125](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=879125) on the Debian BTS. if you are interested in maintaining the package yourself upstream, that's also a possibility, especially if you are a debian maintainer or developer. if not, I can also act as a sponsor when a new release is published.

This is just a notification, but can also act as a coordination point for upstream packaging if you wish to followup on this. otherwise, feel free to close this issue whenever you like.

Thank you for your attention.

items.title: Use requests-file on windows (automatically created file paths)
items.body:
Hey guys, 

I am building paths in my test files automaticaly using `os.sep`. If I build paths to files they are created with a `\`. Later in the code I use the `FileAdapter`. The problem here is: It decodes all paths with `/` so the automatically created windows paths will not be decoded propperly and raise an Exception.

Regards,
Kono

items.title: Name file include spec symbol not correct parse.
items.body:
Hello!
Sample local url 'url = 'file:///C:/blabla/ru.plus.launcher_2.0_TESTBUILD#5_4_minAPI14.apk''
Special characters available in the file name https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/177506 section "MORE INFORMATION"
'#' good symbol

path_parts = [unquote(p) for p in url_parts.path.split('/')]

replace to

url_parts_path = url_parts.path
if url_parts.fragment:
    url_parts_path += '#' + url_parts.fragment
path_parts = [unquote(p) for p in url_parts_path.path.split('/')]

thanks in advance, best regards

items.title: Please made adapter cross-platform - a variant solution in ticket.
items.body:
file-adapter don't download on windows.
if 'path_parts = [unquote(p) for p in url_parts.path.split('/')]'
replace to
'drive, filepath = os.path.splitdrive(url_parts.path)
path_parts = [unquote(p) for p in filepath.replace('\\', '/').split('/')]'
and
'path_parts[0] = os.sep'
replace to
'path_parts[0] = drive + os.sep'
file-adapter work on windows and unix-like system.
thanks in advance, best regards

items.title: Error Windows 7 x64 python 2.7.8
items.body:
Hello!
Error Windows 7 x64 python 2.7.8

Error Windows 7 x64 python 2.7.8
    resp_str = str(e).encode(locale.nl_langinfo(locale.CODESET))
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'nl_langinfo'

maybe better to use '.encode(locale.getpreferredencoding())' to resolve this error?
